verses.kjv: Hear this word, ye kine of Bashan, that are in the mountain of Samaria, which oppress the poor, which crush the needy, which say to their masters, Bring, and let us drink.
verses.ct: Listen to this message, you well-fed cows of Bashan living on the mountain of Samaria — you women who exploit the poor and crush those in need, who tell your husbands, 'Bring us something to drink!'

verses.kjv: The Lord GOD hath sworn by his holiness, that, lo, the days shall come upon you, that he will take you away with hooks, and your posterity with fishhooks.
verses.ct: The Lord GOD has sworn by his holiness: Pay attention — the days are coming when they will drag you away with hooks, and your descendants with fishhooks.

verses.kjv: And ye shall go out at the breaches, every cow at that which is before her; and ye shall cast them into the palace, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: Each of you will be led out through gaps in the walls, one after another, and you will be thrown out toward Harmon, declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Come to Bethel, and transgress; at Gilgal multiply transgression; and bring your sacrifices every morning, and your tithes after three years:
verses.ct: Go ahead to Bethel and sin! Go to Gilgal and sin even more! Bring your sacrifices every morning and your tithes every 3 years.

verses.kjv: And offer a sacrifice of thanksgiving with leaven, and proclaim and publish the free offerings: for this liketh you, O ye children of Israel, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.ct: Burn your thanksgiving offerings made with yeast, and announce your voluntary offerings — brag about them! After all, that's what you love to do, people of Israel, declares the Lord GOD.

verses.kjv: And I also have given you cleanness of teeth in all your cities, and want of bread in all your places: yet have ye not returned unto me, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: I'm the one who gave you empty stomachs in every city and a shortage of food in every town. Still, you did not come back to me, declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: And also I have withholden the rain from you, when there were yet three months to the harvest: and I caused it to rain upon one city, and caused it not to rain upon another city: one piece was rained upon, and the piece whereupon it rained not withered.
verses.ct: I also held back the rain from you when there were still 3 months until harvest. I sent rain on one city but withheld it from another. One field received rain while another field got none and dried up.

verses.kjv: So two or three cities wandered unto one city, to drink water; but they were not satisfied: yet have ye not returned unto me, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: People from 2 or 3 towns staggered to another town looking for water but couldn't find enough. Still, you did not come back to me, declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: I have smitten you with blasting and mildew: when your gardens and your vineyards and your fig trees and your olive trees increased, the palmerworm devoured them: yet have ye not returned unto me, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: I struck your crops with blight and mildew. Locusts devoured your gardens, your vineyards, your fig trees, and your olive trees. Still, you did not come back to me, declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: I have sent among you the pestilence after the manner of Egypt: your young men have I slain with the sword, and have taken away your horses; and I have made the stink of your camps to come up unto your nostrils: yet have ye not returned unto me, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: I sent plagues among you like the ones I sent on Egypt. I killed your young men with the sword and captured your horses. I made the stench of your army camps rise into your nostrils. Still, you did not come back to me, declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: I have overthrown some of you, as God overthrew Sodom and Gomorrah, and ye were as a firebrand plucked out of the burning: yet have ye not returned unto me, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: I destroyed some of you the way God destroyed Sodom and Gomorrah. You were like a burning stick pulled from the fire. Still, you did not come back to me, declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Therefore thus will I do unto thee, O Israel: and because I will do this unto thee, prepare to meet thy God, O Israel.
verses.ct: So this is what I am going to do to you, Israel. And because I am going to do this to you — get ready to face your God, Israel.

verses.kjv: For, lo, he that formeth the mountains, and createth the wind, and declareth unto man what is his thought, that maketh the morning darkness, and treadeth upon the high places of the earth, The LORD, The God of hosts, is his name.
verses.ct: For the one who shapes the mountains and creates the wind, who reveals his thoughts to humanity, who turns the dawn into darkness and walks on the heights of the earth — the LORD, the God of Armies, is his name.
